9faad5df15c2166d039c2c4096b2a9de5437998d.caption:
This soy garlic chicken is one of my families all time favorite recipes. It’s a simpler version  of my mom’s soy garlic fried chicken.  The chicken is pan-fried until super crispy and then glazed with this 5 ingredient sauce. Make sure to double the glaze amount below if you want some extra sauce to put on your rice. Follow me for more simple recipes like this.

Please see recipe below:
For the chicken 
-4 boneless skin on chicken thighs lightly salted 
-1/4C cornstarch
-2tbs neutral oil for pan-frying

Sauce:
-3tbs butter
-3tbs minced garlic
-1tbs minced ginger
-4tbs light brown sugar
-4tbs kikoman light soy sauce 

Garnish with scallion greens thinly sliced

recipe.title: Soy Garlic Chicken
recipe.description: A simpler version of soy garlic fried chicken. The chicken is pan-fried until super crispy and then glazed with a 5 ingredient sauce.

ingredients.name: boneless skin on chicken thighs, lightly salted

instructions: Lightly salt the boneless skin-on chicken thighs
Coat the chicken thighs with cornstarch
Heat neutral oil in a pan for frying
Pan-fry the chicken until super crispy
For the sauce, melt butter in a pan
Add minced garlic and ginger to the melted butter
Add light brown sugar and Kikkoman light soy sauce
Glaze the crispy chicken with the sauce
Garnish with thinly sliced scallion greens
Serve (double the glaze amount if you want extra sauce for rice)

b7d6291e14a9213cf87d2a93ed36e773f89cabf1.caption:
Beef ho (chow) fun 🍜🥢

My FAVOURITE 20 minute high protein recipe of all time

For the beef:
* 400-500g skirt/flank beef steak, trimmed
* 1 tsp light soy sauce
* 1 tsp dark soy sauce
* 1 teaspoon cornstarch
* 1 tsp bicarb soda
* 1 tsp sugar
* 1 Tbsp high-fry oil
 
For the stir fry:
* 2 Tbsp high-fry oil
* 200g beansprouts
* 1 bunch spring onions, chopped roughly
* 3 cloves garlic, chopped
* (Optional) 1 bunch tender-stem Broccoli (broccolini)
Then:
* 400-500g flat rice noodles

For the sauce:
* 1 Tbsp dark soy sauce
* 1 Tbsp light soy sauce
* 2 Tbsp oyster sauce
* 1 Tbsp sesame oil
* 1 tsp sugar
* 1 lemon juice

Method:
1. Cut thin slices of beef
2. Coat beef slices in ingredients and set aside for 10 minutes (or ideally 30 if you have time!)
3. Cut all your other ingredients to size
4. If you have dried rice noodles, cook them per packet instructions and rinse once cooked
5. Fry in a wok or a large fry pan on high heat the beef with a bit of high-fry oil
6. Set aside beef once browned
7. Add all other stir fry ingredients and cook for 2 minutes 
8. Add the noodles
9. Add all sauces to a bowl and then into the stir fry and coat the noodles until brown colour 
10. Add the beef back in and cook for 2 minutes
11. Serve hot & fresh

#beefhofun #highprotein #asianfood

recipe.title: Beef Ho Fun (Beef Chow Fun)
recipe.description: A 20 minute high protein recipe featuring beef and flat rice noodles in a savory sauce.
instructions: Cut thin slices of beef
Coat beef slices in marinade ingredients (light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, cornstarch, bicarb soda, sugar, and oil) and set aside for 10 minutes (or ideally 30 if you have time!)
Cut all your other ingredients to size
If you have dried rice noodles, cook them per packet instructions and rinse once cooked
Fry in a wok or a large fry pan on high heat the beef with a bit of high-fry oil
Set aside beef once browned
Add all other stir fry ingredients and cook for 2 minutes
Add the noodles
Add all sauces to a bowl and then into the stir fry and coat the noodles until brown colour
Add the beef back in and cook for 2 minutes
Serve hot & fresh
